creating the same resource multiple times.,In other words, if GET /users returns a list of users, then HEAD /users will 
make the same request but will not return the list of users.,HEAD requests are useful for checking what a GET request will return before 
actually making a GET request - like before downloading a large file or response 
body.,The following table compares the two HTTP methods: GET and POST.
